You might not agree with me but no amount of number changes will make Kai'Sa a well balanced champion. 

* Her Passive allows her to secure kills, even if the rest of her abilities would be made to be weak. Not to mention allies can apply Plasma stacks with CC.
* Her Q allows her to farm effectively, kite by casting it while moving away, can be a poke tool if enemies get too close.
* Her W is an another Poke tool, a really long ranged one too, can be used to detonate Plasma stacks (like Varus).
* Her E is a really strong Attack Speed steroid, reduces the cooldown of the ability per basic attack, and on top of it all the evolved version gives Invisibility.
* Her R is a massive long ranged disengage/engage/reposition dash tool with a massive shield on top of it all.
* She has both AD and AP scallings on all of her abilities making her item building extremely flexible.
* She has mixed damage (both physical and magical), and % missing health damage.

She just has too much of everything.

As for Lucian, I will skip him because I have no reasonable thoughts about the champion.

Hello LoL Boards!
An Ahri main here, with a 3-year experience, 1million and 400k points and a diamond 5 player here to share his thoughts on Ahri.

- 6 patches ago Ahri got her charm buff. We, Ahri mains, had stereotypes about it and had no clue that it would make her strong. I personally wanted more damage into her W. Now that  i think of it, Ahri would just go back to Gunblade Lich meta again.
Back to the buff. The buff was far stronger than what any Ahri main would  have expected.  Her wr got higher, and she was in top 5 mids very soon.
So all those things show that the buff was really good and it made Ahri S tier, which she hasn`t been since then in S8. So, what should i say and what is my opinion?
- The buff was huge. What most players don`t realize is that she even got a mana buff, which didn`t do anything at all. Yes, from then on you can throw 2 charms except 1 till 6th level and Lost Chapter, but the mana wasnt problem really after Lost Chapter.
- The buff shows how strong CC is. `Just` 40% made her S tier from B, and her banrate was higher  a lot, too.
- What should be done with Ahri now and is the nerf going in the  right direction?
 Completely yes! They are nerfing Ahri the way she should be nerfed - her safety. What makes Ahri strong ( not broken!) is her ability to do well even if you mess up because her safety is really high. This nerf will delay your ult by 20 seconds, which is huge for Ahri counters ( LB, Vlad, Fizz). It will make her hard matchups harder, and make them require more skill which is what i really love. 
- Now, what else should be done to Ahri?
Bring back her dash-stopping mechanic, but make her E cooldown higher by 3-4 seconds. Why? SKILLED Ahri players will save their charms for the critical moment, while unskilled ones will most likely miss it or use to combo. This would make even more difference between a good Ahri and a bad one. Also, this is the  direction they wanted to go in. `Make her highs higher and lows lower` 

-Ahri mains will say Ahri is weak(most of them). No she isnt. She is strong and S tier atm, but nowhere near broken. Is the nerf deserved? Yes? Should there be more? No

To conclude, this nerf is a nice one but there`s more work to be done. I hope i didnt confuse people because im really tired. Good luck on the Rift!
